awd_titl_txt: Regulation of Gene Transcription: DNA Methylation and       Trans-activator Protein Binding
awd_abstract_narration: Research under this ROW Research Planning grant will use the                    regulatory sequences of the human immunodeficiency virus to study               transcriptional regulation and protein binding.  The purpose of                 the research is to determine if there is a relationship between                 DNA methylation and protein binding and to understand the rate of               that interaction in the regulation of gene expression.  This                    system is an excellent one for this study because so many of the                regulatory elements also regulate cellular genes and thus this                  important virus will serve as a model system.
org_div_long_name: Division of Molecular and Cellular Biosciences
